chess

Class FileRank

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.FileRank

  • public class FileRank
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class that helps manage the location of a game piece on the board. The game board is an 8x8 square. Each location has a name specified in "FileRank" format (e.g. "a1"). This utility helps to translate this location name into an "(x,y)" coordinate format.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Toni Au

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileRank

        public FileRank(java.lang.String fileRankName)
        Constructor of a FileRank object. Each square on the 8x8 chess game board is represented with a FileRank coordinate. The "File" ranges from "a" to "h". The "Rank" ranges from "1" to "8".
        Parameters:
        fileRankName - A location specified in the FileRank format (e.g "e4")

      • FileRank

        public FileRank(int xValue,
                int yValue)
        A constructor to create a new FileRank object mapped to location (x,y) on the game board.
        Parameters:
        xValue - "X" value (i.e. File) of the game board location
        yValue - "Y" value (i.e. Rank) of the game board location

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the location name in coordinate format (e.g. "e4")
        Returns:
        Return the location name

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the X-coordinate from this FileRank object.
        Returns:
        Return the x-coordinate as an integer

      • getX

        public int getX(java.lang.String FileRankString)
        Get the x-coordinate of a given FileRank. For example, the x-coordinate for FileRank "a1" is "0".
        Parameters:
        FileRankString - A location specified as a FileRank such as "e4"
        Returns:
        Return the x-coordinate of the given fileRank

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the y-coordinate from this FileRank object.
        Returns:
        Return the y-coordinate as an integer

      • getY

        public int getY(java.lang.String FileRankString)
        Get the y-coordinate of a given FileRank. For example, the y-coordinate for FileRank "a1" is "0".
        Parameters:
        FileRankString - A location specified as a FileRank such as "e4"
        Returns:
        Return the y-coordinate of the given fileRank

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(java.lang.String fileRank)
        Check if a given FileRank is valid for a chess game board.
        Parameters:
        fileRank - A fileRank location such as "e4"
        Returns:
        Return "true" if the given fileRank is valid. Otherwise, return "false".

      • getFile

        public java.lang.String getFile()
        Get the "File" from this fileRank object. The "File" is the first letter in the name of this fileRank object.
        Returns:
        Return the "File" from this fileRank object

      • getRank

        public java.lang.String getRank()
        Get the "Rank" from this fileRank object. The "Rank" is the second letter in the name of this fileRank object.
        Returns:
        Return the "Rank" from this fileRank object

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(java.lang.String newLoc)
        Move the coordinate stored in this fileRank object to a new location.
        Parameters:
        newLoc - A new location for this FileRank object.
        Returns:
        Return "true" if the given location is valid and has been stored.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(FileRank aLoc)
        Check if a given FileRank object has the same location with this FileRank object.
        Parameters:
        aLoc - A location specified as a FileRank object
        Returns:
        Return "true" if the locations between the two FileRank objects are the same. Otherwise, return "false".
